Looking Ahead to Ignite & Our Partnership with Microsoft The summer of 2018 was a great one for Turbonomic. One of our summer highlights was the announcement of our formal partnership with Microsoft as a preferred partner for cloud assessments, migration and continuous optimization. We could not be more excited to work with Microsoft to help customers by delivering the industry’s fastest, most accurate cloud assessments, cloud-ready migration plans and market leading optimization in Azure.
Our commitment is to turn our summer fling into a long-term partnership, starting with our platinum sponsorship at Microsoft Ignite in Orlando. If you are going, find us at Booth 315 to learn more about our partnership with Microsoft and how we are accelerating Azure Migrations. We are also excited to announce that our Cloud CTO, Mor Cohen-Tal, will be presenting in a dedicated theater session. She will highlight why Microsoft chose Turbonomic to be the premier partner for preparing customers for Windows and SQL Server 2008 end of support by utilizing our cloud assessments and migration planning. We hope to see you there! Platform Update We are delighted to announce the latest version of Turbonomic, 6.2, is ready for Early Access. We value your feedback and hope you’ll consider continuing your work with us in building the best product for our customers!
New capabilities ready for you to try out in your environment include:
- Improved public cloud scaling actions across AWS and Azure including the ability to trade off between performance and costs
- Incorporation and management of constraints imposed by Azure and AWS on automating vertical scaling actions
- Ability to plan cloud migrations based on bring your own license (BYOL) in AWS or Azure Hybrid Benefit
- Understanding of Reserved Instance savings associated with migrating workloads to Azure
- Ability to define and include pre-negotiated discounts for AWS and Azure in our actions and cloud views
- Scope and manage cloud environments based on AWS accounts, Azure subscriptions and Azure resource groups
- Improved AWS Reserved Instance purchase analysis and recommendation including target coverage, zone and custom AMI OS aware
- Continued improvements of our core analytics (aka the market) for on-prem and public cloud environments
- Single Sign On (SSO) and SAML integration for your Turbonomic instance
Interested in learning more about any of the above features? Email Product Leader, Ben Yemini, at ben.yemini@turbonomic.com <[[mailto:ben.yemini@turbonomic.com]]> to get involved or ask any questions! News and Customer Success Right before VMworld US 2018, Turbonomic announced <[[https://turbonomic.com/press-releases/kubernetes-containers/]]>that it extended its unique self-managing Kubernetes capabilities with new support for Amazon Elastic Container Service for Kubernetes (EKS), Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE), and Pivotal Container Service (PKS). The new capabilities enable you to continuously assure performance, maximize elasticity and maintain compliance with business policies across your Kubernetes-as-a-Service (KaaS) offering of choice. Learn more in this Webinar replay <[[https://resources.turbonomic.com/container-platforms/webinar-turbonomic-for-amazon-eks-azure-aks-google-gke-and-pivotal-pks]]>.
Computerworld UK recently published an article <[[https://www.computerworlduk.com/cloud-computing/how-avoid-overspending-on-cloud-3682564/]]>with top tips for how to avoid overspending on cloud. The article highlights commentary about the important role workload automation plays: “Simply put, the complexities of the cloud are beyond human scale and the only reliable way to balance price, performance, and compliance is to automate.”
We are proud to have recently been awarded <[[https://turbonomic.com/press-releases/aws-cloud-migration/]]> AWS Migration Competency status <[[https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/apn/say-hello-to-48-new-aws-competency-partners-added-in-july/]]>, differentiating Turbonomic as an AWS Partner Network (APN) company that provides AWS customers with discovery, planning, and ongoing optimization of their AWS instances.
If you’re a Cisco customer, don’t miss this article <[[https://www.crn.com/slide-shows/networking/chuck-robbins-five-bold-statements-on-cisco-s-software-revolution]]>from CRN highlighting five of the boldest statements from its recent interview with Cisco Chairman and CEO, Chuck Robbins.
We are incredibly honored to have made our third appearance on the Inc. 5000 <[[https://turbonomic.com/press-releases/inc5000-award/]]>, the most prestigious ranking of the nation’s fastest-growing private companies. This achievement is a direct result of your partnership and trust in Turbonomic. THANK YOU to our outstanding customers for helping us achieve this most recent recognition!
